        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply patch to chromeos<span class="line"><!---->1. apply patch to chromeos<!----></span><br>This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<span class="line"><!---->This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<span class="line"><!---->index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<!----></span><br> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<span class="line"><!----> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<!----></span><br>     const std::string& user_locale,<span class="line"><!---->     const std::string&amp; Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<span class="line"><!---->2. Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<!----></span><br>3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<span class="line"><!---->3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<!----></span><br>4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<span class="line"><!---->4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>## Root Cause and some notes<span class="line"><!---->## Root Cause and some notes<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<!----></span><br><br>[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<span class="line"><!---->[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<!----></span><br>, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<span class="line"><!---->, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<!----></span><br><br>The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<!----></span><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// static<span class="line"><!---->// static<!----></span><br>std::unique_ptr<HatsDialog> HatsDialog::CreateAndShow(<span class="line"><!---->std::unique_ptr&lt;HatsDialog&gt; Since the UI context that is<span class="line"><!---->original HaTS notification was clicked. Since the UI context that is<!----></span><br>tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<span class="line"><!---->tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<!----></span><br>situation.<span class="line"><!---->situation.<!----></span><br><br>This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<span class="line"><!---->This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<!----></span><br>that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<span class="line"><!---->that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<!----></span><br>exist before creating the dialog.<span class="line"><!---->exist before creating the dialog.<!----></span><br><br>It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<span class="line"><!---->It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<!----></span><br>HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<!----></span><br>handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<span class="line"><!---->handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<!----></span><br>originally occurred.<span class="line"><!---->originally occurred.<!----></span><br><br>There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<span class="line"><!---->There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<!----></span><br>1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<span class="line"><!---->1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<!----></span><br>expected.<span class="line"><!---->expected.<!----></span><br>2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<!----></span><br>to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<!----></span><br>different account, and then switches back to the original account before<span class="line"><!---->different account, and then switches back to the original account before<!----></span><br>the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<!----></span><br>original user has a valid UI context.<span class="line"><!---->original user has a valid UI context.<!----></span><br><br>These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<span class="line"><!---->These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<!----></span><br>beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<span class="line"><!---->beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<!----></span><br>time to manually switch between accounts. Since the UI context that is<span class="line"><!---->original HaTS notification was clicked. Since the UI context that is<!----></span><br>tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<span class="line"><!---->tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<!----></span><br>situation.<span class="line"><!---->situation.<!----></span><br><br>This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<span class="line"><!---->This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<!----></span><br>that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<span class="line"><!---->that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<!----></span><br>exist before creating the dialog.<span class="line"><!---->exist before creating the dialog.<!----></span><br><br>It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<span class="line"><!---->It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<!----></span><br>HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<!----></span><br>handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<span class="line"><!---->handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<!----></span><br>originally occurred.<span class="line"><!---->originally occurred.<!----></span><br><br>There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<span class="line"><!---->There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<!----></span><br>1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<span class="line"><!---->1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<!----></span><br>expected.<span class="line"><!---->expected.<!----></span><br>2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<!----></span><br>to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<!----></span><br>different account, and then switches back to the original account before<span class="line"><!---->different account, and then switches back to the original account before<!----></span><br>the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<!----></span><br>original user has a valid UI context.<span class="line"><!---->original user has a valid UI context.<!----></span><br><br>These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<span class="line"><!---->These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<!----></span><br>beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<span class="line"><!---->beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<!----></span><br>time to manually switch between accounts.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Since the UI context that is<span class="line"><!---->original HaTS notification was clicked. Since the UI context that is<!----></span><br>tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<span class="line"><!---->tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<!----></span><br>situation.<span class="line"><!---->situation.<!----></span><br><br>This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<span class="line"><!---->This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<!----></span><br>that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<span class="line"><!---->that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<!----></span><br>exist before creating the dialog.<span class="line"><!---->exist before creating the dialog.<!----></span><br><br>It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<span class="line"><!---->It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<!----></span><br>HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<!----></span><br>handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<span class="line"><!---->handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<!----></span><br>originally occurred.<span class="line"><!---->originally occurred.<!----></span><br><br>There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<span class="line"><!---->There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<!----></span><br>1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<span class="line"><!---->1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<!----></span><br>expected.<span class="line"><!---->expected.<!----></span><br>2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<!----></span><br>to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<!----></span><br>different account, and then switches back to the original account before<span class="line"><!---->different account, and then switches back to the original account before<!----></span><br>the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<!----></span><br>original user has a valid UI context.<span class="line"><!---->original user has a valid UI context.<!----></span><br><br>These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<span class="line"><!---->These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<!----></span><br>beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<span class="line"><!---->beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<!----></span><br>time to manually switch between accounts.        Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;

            position: static;
          }
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1320139%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2600" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1320139%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2600%252526ust%25253D1703405649204273%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1RK_yP2nFfrmagMYv2AHgA%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;

          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply patch to chromeos<span class="line"><!---->1. apply patch to chromeos<!----></span><br>This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<span class="line"><!---->This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<span class="line"><!---->index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<!----></span><br> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<span class="line"><!----> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<!----></span><br>     const std::string& user_locale,<span class="line"><!---->     const std::string&amp; context;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>   context[KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey::BROWSER)] =<span class="line"><!---->   context[KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey::BROWSER)] =<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2. Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<span class="line"><!---->2. Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<!----></span><br>3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<span class="line"><!---->3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<!----></span><br>4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<span class="line"><!---->4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>## Root Cause and some notes<span class="line"><!---->## Root Cause and some notes<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<!----></span><br><br>[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<span class="line"><!---->[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<!----></span><br>, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<span class="line"><!---->, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<!----></span><br><br>The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<!----></span><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// static<span class="line"><!---->// static<!----></span><br>std::unique_ptr<HatsDialog> HatsDialog::CreateAndShow(<span class="line"><!---->std::unique_ptr&lt;HatsDialog&gt; user_locale,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;GetFormattedSiteContext, user_locale,<!----></span><br>                     product_specific_data),<span class="line"><!---->                     product_specific_data),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&HatsDialog::Show, base::Unretained(hats_dialog.get()))); //[0]<span class="line"><!---->         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824"><!---->209ccf99e39669294e1d2bfd64e80b714f61d824<!----></a><br>Author: Jack Shira <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jack Shira &lt;<!----></span>jackshira@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jackshira@google.com"><!---->jackshira@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Sep 06 22:06:58 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Sep 06 22:06:58 2022<!----></span><br><br>[CrOS HaTS] Fix UAF issue with HatsDialog<span class="line"><!---->[CrOS HaTS] Fix UAF issue with HatsDialog<!----></span><br><br>When switching users, the current implementation of HatsDialog always<span class="line"><!---->When switching users, the current implementation of HatsDialog always<!----></span><br>passes in the active user sessions, which may have changed since the<span class="line"><!---->passes in the active user sessions, which may have changed since the<!----></span><br>original HaTS notification was clicked. Since the UI context that is<span class="line"><!---->original HaTS notification was clicked. Since the UI context that is<!----></span><br>tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<span class="line"><!---->tied to that user may no longer be available, a UAF can occur in this<!----></span><br>situation.<span class="line"><!---->situation.<!----></span><br><br>This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<span class="line"><!---->This change checks to see if the current user is still the same user<!----></span><br>that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<span class="line"><!---->that activated the notification, ensuring that the UI context will<!----></span><br>exist before creating the dialog.<span class="line"><!---->exist before creating the dialog.<!----></span><br><br>It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<span class="line"><!---->It also moves the triggering logic for the HatsDialog into the<!----></span><br>HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<!----></span><br>handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<span class="line"><!---->handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<!----></span><br>originally occurred.<span class="line"><!---->originally occurred.<!----></span><br><br>There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<span class="line"><!---->There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<!----></span><br>1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<span class="line"><!---->1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<!----></span><br>expected.<span class="line"><!---->expected.<!----></span><br>2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<!----></span><br>to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<!----></span><br>different account, and then switches back to the original account before<span class="line"><!---->different account, and then switches back to the original account before<!----></span><br>the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<!----></span><br>original user has a valid UI context.<span class="line"><!---->original user has a valid UI context.<!----></span><br><br>These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<span class="line"><!---->These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<!----></span><br>beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<span class="line"><!---->beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<!----></span><br>time to manually switch between accounts. The following arguments were<span class="line"><!---->time to manually switch between accounts. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;

          cursor: pointer;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        }

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        }

          margin-top: 40px;

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply patch to chromeos<span class="line"><!---->1. apply patch to chromeos<!----></span><br>This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<span class="line"><!---->This is to increase the race time, and it can also block the GetFormattedSiteContext function.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<span class="line"><!---->index da7f247164c47..5bc8752eb4ca7 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/chrome/browser/ash/hats/hats_dialog.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -91,6 +91,7 @@ const std::string KeyEnumToString(DeviceInfoKey key) {<!----></span><br> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<span class="line"><!----> std::string HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext(<!----></span><br>     const std::string& user_locale,<span class="line"><!---->     const std::string&amp; Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<span class="line"><!---->2. Make sure your chromeos is pre-configured with two login users, refer to my video.<!----></span><br>3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<span class="line"><!---->3. out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=/tmp/s289 --login-manager --force-happiness-tracking-system<!----></span><br>4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<span class="line"><!---->4. Wait Survey Notification popup, click it, then switch to other login user.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>## Root Cause and some notes<span class="line"><!---->## Root Cause and some notes<!----></span><br><br>[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<span class="line"><!---->[0] The `hats_dialog.get()` raw ptr is posted to a separate sequence<!----></span><br><br>[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<span class="line"><!---->[1] `hats_dialog` may be destroyed in UI when GetFormattedSiteContext runs<!----></span><br>, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<span class="line"><!---->, causing a UAF in HatsDialog::Show callback.<!----></span><br><br>The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->The pattern of this vulnerability is similar to this issue.<!----></span><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1233975<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// static<span class="line"><!---->// static<!----></span><br>std::unique_ptr<HatsDialog> HatsDialog::CreateAndShow(<span class="line"><!---->std::unique_ptr&lt;HatsDialog&gt; This allows the controller to properly<span class="line"><!---->HatsNotificationController. This allows the controller to properly<!----></span><br>handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<span class="line"><!---->handle the life-cycle of the dialog, and prevents the UAF issue that<!----></span><br>originally occurred.<span class="line"><!---->originally occurred.<!----></span><br><br>There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<span class="line"><!---->There are three different scenarios that were manually tested:<!----></span><br>1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<span class="line"><!---->1. Normal path: The user stays logged in and sees the dialog as<!----></span><br>expected.<span class="line"><!---->expected.<!----></span><br>2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<span class="line"><!---->2. Switch path: The user clicks the notification and switches<!----></span><br>to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<span class="line"><!---->to a different account before the dialog is displayed. In this case,<!----></span><br>the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog will not be displayed since a different user is using the<!----></span><br>device.<span class="line"><!---->device.<!----></span><br>3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<span class="line"><!---->3. Switch back path: The user clicks the notification, switches to a<!----></span><br>different account, and then switches back to the original account before<span class="line"><!---->different account, and then switches back to the original account before<!----></span><br>the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<span class="line"><!---->the dialog is displayed. In this case, the dialog is displayed since the<!----></span><br>original user has a valid UI context.<span class="line"><!---->original user has a valid UI context.<!----></span><br><br>These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<span class="line"><!---->These tests were conducted by adding a `sleep(20);` call to the<!----></span><br>beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<span class="line"><!---->beginning of `HatsDialog::GetFormattedSiteContext` to allow the tester<!----></span><br>time to manually switch between accounts.
